author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...KIKO STEADILY WEAKENS BUT REMAINS A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...
summary: ...KIKO STEADILY WEAKENS BUT REMAINS A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... As of 5:00 PM HST Mon Sep 08 the center of Kiko was located near 21.6, -150.9 with movement NW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 997 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...KIKO STEADILY WEAKENS BUT REMAINS A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...FORECAST TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... As of 5:00 PM HST Mon Sep 08 the center of Kiko was located near 21.6, -150.9 with movement NW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 997 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Kiko (CP4/EP112025)
